name: Red Dates With Warm Osmanthus Blossom Syrup
description: This traditional Shanghai dish celebrates the fragrance of osmanthus flowers along with the deep red, honey-sweetness of red dates (also known as jujubes). Served hot, each date bursts with a soft core of sticky rice, drenched in osmanthus-infused syrup. This dish looks impressively difficult but is very easy to make. Dried osmanthus flowers can by found in Chinese grocery stores or tea shops.

recipeInstructions.text: Adding 1/2 cup water and sugar to a saucepan, bring to boil then reduce heat and simmer for three minutes. Add osmanthus blossoms, stir, and set aside.
Soak red dates in 1 cup boiling water for 15 minutes. Drain and cool. Then, using pointed scissors, cut dates upon along one side and carefully remove seed.
Combine rice flour and 2 tablespoons water, mixing until it reaches a Play-Do consistency.
Pinch off small pieces of rice paste and roll into cylinders. Place cylinders into each date and press closed.
Bring a large saucepan of water to a boil. Add dates, boil for 3 minutes, and drain. Serve immediately with osmanthus syrup poured over the top.
